header_summary:
Ava Chow announced the availability of the Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc1 release candidate, highlighting it as a major update and inviting users to download and test it. This version aims to improve the Bitcoin software through community feedback before its final release, with detailed insights and expected changes available in the preliminary release notes found [here](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/28.0-Release-Notes-Draft).

Antoine Riard suggested the creation of "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes to facilitate the study of sophisticated cross-layer attacks within the Bitcoin ecosystem, enhancing the ecosystem's security through real-world testing. This initiative emphasizes the importance of testing on the mainnet to accurately evaluate the security and robustness of Bitcoin and lightning networks, as outlined in the Linux Foundation's mailing list archive [here](https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2021-May/018925.html).

Additionally, discussions led by Antoine Riard and others have delved into the complexities of Bitcoin transactions, particularly focusing on vulnerabilities such as keyless ephemeral anchors and replacement cycling attacks. This conversation sheds light on the potential for certain actors to exploit transaction batching for malicious purposes, stressing the need for ongoing scrutiny and improvement of transaction management practices, as documented [here](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/57c52a0c-c390-4b7b-8247-8612a489cb98n@googlegroups.com/T/#m16ad74f55ae7be50b7cb0680a10f3e4f775aecdd).

Victor at StarkWare and Fi3 have both contributed to the evolving narrative around Bitcoin's capabilities, with discussions on enhancing Bitcoin's computational functions and mining transparency, respectively. Victor discussed the potential for general computation on Bitcoin through the re-enabling of the OP_CAT opcode and the integration of covenants and STARK proofs, aiming to vastly expand Bitcoin's utility. Fi3's work on an SV2 extension seeks to provide miners with greater autonomy and fairness in selecting mining jobs, reflecting the ongoing efforts to improve the transparency and efficiency of Bitcoin mining, as detailed [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/the-path-to-general-computation-on-bitcoin-with-op-cat/1106) and [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/pplns-with-job-declaration/1099).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Candidate 1 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc1 is now available for user testing and review.
- Preliminary release notes offer insights into the new update's changes and improvements.
- Release candidates allow user feedback to identify issues before the final version release.

recent_posts.title: Demonstrating Pinning Attacks under Real-World Conditions
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine proposes establishing "free-to-pwn" lightning nodes to test attacks on Bitcoin's mainnet.
- The initiative aims to demonstrate the feasibility and severity of cross-layer attacks in a realistic setting.
- He highlights the importance of public attack demonstrations to assess the protocol's security accurately.

recent_posts.title: Keyless Anchors Are Vulnerable To Replacement Cycling Attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses vulnerabilities in Bitcoin transactions, like ephemeral anchors and replacement attacks.
- It highlights risks for entities batching transactions, exploiting positions for malicious activities.
- Talks about challenges in countering attacks due to node constraints and potential DDoS vulnerabilities.

recent_posts.title: The path to general computation on Bitcoin (with OP_CAT)
recent_posts.summary:
- Taproot upgrade enhances Bitcoin script capabilities, enabling complex applications since 2021.
- Covenants and STARK proofs introduce statefulness and scalability, expanding Bitcoin's utility.
- OP_CAT reactivation could unlock vast computational potential, with projects under development.

recent_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
recent_posts.summary:
- Development of an SV2 extension for fairer mining pool payouts is occurring.
- This extension increases miners' control by allowing transaction selection.
- The project seeks reviews to refine the proposed system, still in development.

active_posts.title: Mining pools, stratumv2 and oblivious shares
active_posts.summary:
- Stratum V2's template distribution via client push presents risks for mining pools.
- A proposed solution is a negotiated template approach to enhance security and fairness.
- The email advocates for significant changes in bitcoin mining to improve decentralization.

active_posts.title: OP_ZKP updates
active_posts.summary:
- The OP_ZKP proposal integrates ZKPs in Bitcoin, focusing on an apt ZKP scheme.
- Key requirements include minimal security assumptions, small block size consumption, and batched verification.
- Future adoption considers low-powered device performance and potential alternatives like Dory if issues persist.

active_posts.title: OP_CAT Research Fund sponsored by StarkWare
active_posts.summary:
- StarkWare launched a $1 million bounty initiative focusing on OP_CAT activation insights.
- The initiative features a committee with members from Blockstream, Chaincode, and other notable organizations.
- It aims to foster community debate on OP_CAT's activation, implications, and utility for Bitcoin.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis details Bitcoin protocol vulnerabilities and suggests improvements for security and performance.
- Proposals include adjusting mining difficulty, restricting legacy transactions, and enforcing consensus on contentious issues.
- Community debate centers on block size reduction's impact on scalability and efficiency, with suggestions for technical standardization.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- Recent crackdowns have significantly altered the Bitcoin privacy service landscape.
- The BTCPay Server CoinJoin plugin, using the WabiSabi protocol, has been introduced.
- The author has established their own BTCPay coordinator service to enhance privacy options.
